page.title: 04 Motney Hill sewage works 1
page.content: Motney Hill sewage works was built in 1926 to handle the sewage output of the Medway towns and to relieve pressure on an existing works at the Strand Gillingham. On a dry day it processes 10^7 gallons of effluent. On a wet day this figure rises to as much as 60^7 gallons depending on the amount of antecedant rainfall. The works is situated on a low sandy hill at the end of the Motney Hill peninsula.The works is owned and operated by The Southern Water Authority.It employes 9 plant operators and 3 fitters. The yearly running costs are 600,000 pounds, 10% of this is spent on electricity for the pumps. Land on the site is leased for agriculture and there are four houses on the site originally for staff.
